content:
On a side topic: I'm looking for good examples of sites where the user can choose between region or even subject matter and then see an entirely different version of the site. So the theme and navigation are roughly the same between versions of the site, but the content is different.

I'm not talking about the same content in different languages, but where different content is presented to users based upon whether they are US based or European based (for example). Any thoughts?

Different versions of the site might have different sub-domain OR just different path, example:

us.example.com
eu.example.com

or

www.example.com/eu
www.example.com/us

https://twitter.com/StPaulTim/status/1224160519894028289

Looking for examples of good "portal" sites with different content per country, region, or other category. A site where user can select between A and B and depending upon choice will see different content (but otherwise, same layout/navigation/theme). Ideas?

- Tim Erickson (@StPaulTim)
I imagine you already know about Domain Access, the Drupal module you'd use to build such a site...? You may be able to find examples by searching for usage of that.
My biggest ongoing client is heavy user of domain access.
Not sure how to find sites using domain access?
